title: Worked Solution
text:
We use the point-slope formula:
$$y$$ - y1 $$=$$ m(x - x1)

Substituting $$m=-6$$ and (x1,y1) $$=$$ $$( rac{1}{4},-2)$$, we get:
$$y$$ - $$(-2)$$ $$=$$ -6(x - 1/4)

Simplifying, we get:
$$y$$ + $$2$$ $$=$$ $$-6x$$ + $$ rac{3}{2}$$

Moving terms to the left-hand side, we get:
$$6x$$ + $$y$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{-7}{2}$$

Multiplying by $$-2$$ to clear fractions and get standard form, we get:
$$-12x$$ - $$2y$$ $$=$$ $$7$$

Therefore, the equation of the line is $$-12x$$ - $$2y$$ $$=$$ $$7$$ in standard form.
